This is because there are two types of “that.”
When “that” is used as a demonstrative adjective, meaning when we say “that window” or “that person,”
then we use the “A” vowel sound, like in the word “cat.”
However, when it is used in phrases like “I think that we should go” or “the people that live next door”
the word “that” is said in its weak form, with a schwa sound.
I know that understanding when and where to use certain words can be quite challenging.
